    About me

    I'm currently a graduate student at Georgia Tech pursuing a M.S. in Analytics with a track focus in Computational Data Science & Machine Learning. I attended Stony Brook University for my undergraduate studies, where I developed a strong foundation in Applied Mathematics & Statistics.

    Through personal projects and coursework, I have honed my skills in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling. Data is an ambigious field nowadays, but to me, data is a tool that helps with storytelling and solve very big and complicated problems. I mostly use Python and R for my data science projects, but love to create data visualizations to show how impactful data can be. I am currently looking for internship and full-time opportunities in data science, analytics, and machine learning roles.

    In my free time, I enjoy eating LOTS, discovering new places, learning new things [random and useless at times], and spending time with friends and family.

    Education

    • Georgia Tech - M.S. Analytics (Data Science) - Expected May 2027
    • Stony Brook University - B.S. Applied Mathematics & Statistics - Graduated May 2025

    Skills

    • Languages: Python, SQL, R
    • ML: scikit-learn, XGBoost, TensorFlow/Keras
    • Data: pandas, numpy, feature engineering, data cleaning
    • Viz: matplotlib, seaborn, Plotly; dashboards in Tableau/Power BI
    • Workflow: Git/GitHub, Jupyter/VS Code; Docker/Flask
